summary.value: A week of blogging, trying to get rid of a mattress, binging all of The Circle, and a slightly over-the-top pizza party.

content.html:
• I finished and published my blog post on the treasure hunt that Glynn and I ran. Iâ€™m pleased with how it came out and Iâ€™ve had some nice feedback. I definitely find it easier to get into the flow of writing after getting into the habit of writing weeknotes.

  • A few of the people from the Minecraft server Iâ€™m part of did a â€œspeedâ€ run one evening. It went spectacularly badly â€“ we used an unstable beta version of the game, it was infuriatingly laggy, and the dragon fight at the end just bugged out and we couldnâ€™t complete it. Itâ€™s really fun when we do these but weâ€™re by no means fast or efficient. The new cave generation is really cool though.

    Annoyed I forgot to hide the debug text

  • I really need to get rid of a mattress, and the Lambeth waste services website is just broken. Iâ€™ve tried it in lots of different browsers, Iâ€™ve tried tweaking the page via the debugger to get it to work, itâ€™s quite annoying. After waiting 10 days for an email response they apologised and suggested I just call them instead ğŸ¤¦

  • I donâ€™t want to talk about house stuff. Itâ€™s moving very slowly is all.

  • We watched the whole latest season of The Circle (UK), I kind of wish I felt shame at how much I enjoyed it, but I just donâ€™t. Itâ€™s been a long time since Iâ€™ve felt so invested in reality TV. If you want some gripping trash then I highly recommend it, it kept me on the edge of my seat until the very end. What a welcome distraction from life and the fact that all my other TV watching is cooking at the moment.

  • We went for pizza in some friends' garden, they have a small pizza oven and itâ€™s amazing! I had such a lovely time, however, I didnâ€™t eat enough pizza and got blackout drunk, so the latter half of the evening is patchy at best. I spent all of the next day in a pit of hungover anxiety. Iâ€™m really far too old for this shit and I need to re-learn my limits after a relatively dry lockdown.

I finished and published my blog post on the treasure hunt that Glynn and I ran. Iâ€™m pleased with how it came out and Iâ€™ve had some nice feedback. I definitely find it easier to get into the flow of writing after getting into the habit of writing weeknotes.

A few of the people from the Minecraft server Iâ€™m part of did a â€œspeedâ€ run one evening. It went spectacularly badly â€“ we used an unstable beta version of the game, it was infuriatingly laggy, and the dragon fight at the end just bugged out and we couldnâ€™t complete it. Itâ€™s really fun when we do these but weâ€™re by no means fast or efficient. The new cave generation is really cool though.

I really need to get rid of a mattress, and the Lambeth waste services website is just broken. Iâ€™ve tried it in lots of different browsers, Iâ€™ve tried tweaking the page via the debugger to get it to work, itâ€™s quite annoying. I donâ€™t want to talk about house stuff. Itâ€™s moving very slowly is all.
We watched the whole latest season of The Circle (UK), I kind of wish I felt shame at how much I enjoyed it, but I just donâ€™t. Itâ€™s been a long time since Iâ€™ve felt so invested in reality TV. If you want some gripping trash then I highly recommend it, it kept me on the edge of my seat until the very end. What a welcome distraction from life and the fact that all my other TV watching is cooking at the moment.
We went for pizza in some friends' garden, they have a small pizza oven and itâ€™s amazing! I had such a lovely time, however, I didnâ€™t eat enough pizza and got blackout drunk, so the latter half of the evening is patchy at best. I spent all of the next day in a pit of hungover anxiety. Iâ€™m really far too old for this shit and I need to re-learn my limits after a relatively dry lockdown.
